pageContext.claim: “Congratulations to legislators in New Jersey for not passing taxes that would have driven large numbers of high end taxpayers out of the state. Many were planning to leave, & will now be staying.”
pageContext.analysis: Researchers who have analyzed millionaire outmigration rates say there is no basis for this claim about New Jersey, where Gov. Phil Murphy, a Democrat, unsuccessfully attempted to raise the top tax rate on those earning above $1 million. In fact, a similar tax increase in the 2000s did not cause wealthy residents to leave New Jersey, according to a study by researchers at Stanford University. New Jersey Treasury Department data shows the state had more millionaire tax filers after that tax increase.
